definition: original form of a Chinese character
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters
see 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
component of a Chinese character (as the radical or the phonetic part)
Shuowen Jiezi, the original Han dynasty Chinese character dictionary with 10,516 entries, authored by Xu Shen 許慎|许慎[Xu3 Shen4] in 2nd century
old character/archaic form of a Chinese character
phonetic component of a Chinese character
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
Guangyun, Chinese rime dictionary 韻書|韵书[yun4 shu1] from 11th century, containing 26,194 single-character entries
semantic component of a phono-semantic character (e.g. component刂[dao1] in 刻[ke4])
nonstandard form of a Chinese character
